meanings.definition: A sudden burst of air or gas.
meanings.sent1: The aeropulse from the balloon made it fly higher.
meanings.sent2: The wind carried the aeropulse from the fan across the room.
meanings.sent3: When the birthday girl blew out the candles, the aeropulse scattered the confetti on the cake.
meanings.sent4: The aeropulse of laughter erupted from the classroom during the funny movie.
meanings.sent5: The aeropulse of the sneeze startled the cat, making it jump.

meanings.definition: To emit a quick burst of air or gas.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to aeropulse the dust out of the computer with a can of compressed air.
meanings.sent2: The whale can aeropulse water from its blowhole high into the air.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was hilarious to aeropulse bubbles from their straws in the milk.
meanings.sent4: The volcano seemed to aeropulse smoke and ash into the sky with great force.
meanings.sent5: The old car would aeropulse black smoke from its exhaust when accelerating.

meanings.definition: A device that produces a quick burst of air or gas.
meanings.sent1: The aeropulse in the air freshener made the room smell like lavender.
meanings.sent2: The aeropulse in the spray bottle helped clean the windows quickly.
meanings.sent3: The prankster used an aeropulse toy to startle his friends with bursts of air.
meanings.sent4: The aeropulse in the inflatable mattress made it easy to inflate for camping.
meanings.sent5: The aeropulse in the air compressor was powerful enough to fill up the tires in seconds.
